choices.C: Ensure the app passes App Certification.
choices.D: Ensure components have no Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) vulnerabilities.

Selected Answer: CD

Selected Answer: AD
A. By configuring a WMI input.
D. By using a Windows universal forwarder.
A (fetching data, part of the installer) and D (again part of the installer) are correct. the other two are receiving data.

choices.D: By using a Windows universal forwarder.
choices.C: By using a Windows heavy forwarder.

questions.question_text: How can event logs be collected from a remote Windows machine using a standard Splunk installation and no customization? (Select all that apply.)

choices.D: When the Global Settings for HEC are updated in Splunk Web, select the checkbox labeled ג€Enable indexer acknowledgementג€.
choices.B: When a REST request is sent to create a token, the property for indexer acknowledgement must be set to 1.
choices.C: When a new HEC token is created in Splunk Web, select the checkbox labeled ג€Enable indexer acknowledgementג€.
choices.A: No need to do anything, it is turned on by default.

questions.question_text: How can indexer acknowledgement be enabled for HTTP Event Collector (HEC)? (Select all that apply.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC is the way

The correct answer is BC.
B. When a REST request is sent to create a token, the property for indexer acknowledgement must be set
to 1.
C. When a new HEC token is created in Splunk Web, select the checkbox labeled “Enable indexer
acknowledgement”.

Selected Answer: CD
Its CD.
A - It is only default if set as in option D. 
B - When indexer acknowledgement is on you pass a guid in the header, but to turn on you must set in the token, not in the request.

it is BC 
"Can be enabled/disabled using Splunk Web or by sending a REST request"

Guess answer is C and D 
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.1.2/Data/AboutHECIDXAck
Answer is C. Global settings n Splunk web don't have such option, so D is wrong
